channel.title: [PI] Quest Point System [PI]
channel.description:
[b]Moparscape Driman Rune's Tutorial #1[/b]
[center][size=20pt][b]Quest Point System:[/b][/size][/center]
[size=10pt][b]What your learning:[/b][/size] How to start making quests for your server! [size=10pt][b]How many Steps:[/b][/size] 1/5 [size=10pt][b]Files Editing:[/b][/size] Player.java, PayerSave.java, Client.java, DialogueHandler.java [size=10pt][b]Estimated Hardness:[/b][/size] 1/10 [size=10pt][b]Comments:[/b][/size] I think this can help some people who are stuck on making quests and making requirements.]
[size=14pt][i]Step 1:[/i][/size]
[b]Have A PI[/b] Make sure you have a PI source. [Project Insanity can also be used]
[b]Explanation(s):[/b] Just download one that has no virus, and works.
[size=14pt][i]Step 2:[/i][/size]
[b]Playersave.java[/b] [b]Add[/b] [code] } else if (token.equals("questpoints")) { p.questPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2); ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ And:
characterfile.write("questpoints = ", 0, 14); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0, Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length()); characterfile.newLine();
[/code]
[b]Explanation(s):[/b] This saves the method your about to add to player.java. so if you logout it will save and not delete.
[size=14pt][i]Step 3:[/i][/size]
[b]Client.java[/b] [b]Add[/b] [code]getPA().sendFrame126("Quest Points: "+questPoints+"", 640);//Change the 640 to any Quest or Achievement Tab #.[/code] [b]Under[/b] [code]public void process() {[/code]
[b]Explanation(s):[/b] This will incrypt it on the quest tab an you will be able to see your quest points, without knowing.
[size=14pt][i]Step 4:[/i][/size]
[b]Player.java[/b] [b]Add[/b] [code]public int questPoints = 0;[/code] [b]Under[/b] [code]public int[/code]
[b]Explanation(s):[/b] This will write down the quest point methods, allowing to add or remove it, also it is a cheap way.
[size=14pt][i]Step 5:[/i][/size]
[b]DialogueHandler.java[/b] [b]Add[/b] [code]questPoints += 1;//Adds the Quest Points, you can change the 1 to any.[/code] [b]or:[/b] [code]questPoints -= 1;//Removes the Quest Points, again change the 1 to any.[/code] [b]Under[/b] [code]Any npc dialogue you want it.[/code]
[b]Explanation(s):[/b] This will add the quest points, or remove.
- Driman Rune

[quote=“DAn0194, post:34, topic:520120”][quote author=blackflag_ link=topic=638612.msg4307493#msg4307493 date=1370151603]

your example; are you serious? your 3 year old allstar base would have horrible performance, stability issues, and bugs you probably didnt notice on it

Not sure if serious… I think you should ask around and find out just who exactly I am. kthxbai

lol? why? you can’t even back up your example, just stop

You just stop… You’re thinking PI is this great source when it’s not.

omg. Compared to his 3 year old all star base? yeah! you wouldn’t think so? jeez,please re-read
[/quote]
If you’re a good developer your winterLove source could be better than a P.I.[/quote]

I’m pretty sure PI is based of winterlove

item.title: [PI] Quest Point System [PI]
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“blackflag_, post:27, topic:520120”][quote author=enzo42 link=topic=638612.msg4306857#msg4306857 date=1370011542]

[quote]Have A PI
Make sure you have a PI source. [Project Insanity can also be used]

PI is shorthand for Project Insanity.
To the tutorial, you didn’t really explain much of the code, plus the terminology is a bit incorrect. (Refer to the above post)
You also didn’t go into depth on how to make this go to use, if at all.

Thanks for contributing, and perhaps you could make a follow-up tutorial on how to create a very basic quest.

Just too funny! Thanks for the sig.

rofl… didnt you post a tutorial for delta

This can be easily converted to Delta with some common Java knowledge. But of course, most of the classes said in the OT are in the main class.

I was just pointing out that he was using a base much lower than PI (no idea why he’s making fun of op)
[/quote]I’m sorry but did you just call Delta lower than another base? FYI, ALL bases are only as good as the developer makes it.

i really dont understand why people choose to work with delta when its genuinely shit, and all the “delta cleaned” “delta packaged”, it really makes no difference, the code is all bad with those sources. why improve it when you could already used an improved source of winterlove like emulous/pi?

[quote]Have A PI
Make sure you have a PI source. [Project Insanity can also be used]

PI is shorthand for Project Insanity.
To the tutorial, you didn’t really explain much of the code, plus the terminology is a bit incorrect. (Refer to the above post)
You also didn’t go into depth on how to make this go to use, if at all.

Thanks for contributing, and perhaps you could make a follow-up tutorial on how to create a very basic quest.

Just too funny! Thanks for the sig.

rofl… didnt you post a tutorial for delta
[/quote]what is your point?

once again, im pointing out that arham is using a shittier source than OP is

[quote]Have A PI
Make sure you have a PI source. [Project Insanity can also be used]

PI is shorthand for Project Insanity.
To the tutorial, you didn’t really explain much of the code, plus the terminology is a bit incorrect. (Refer to the above post)
You also didn’t go into depth on how to make this go to use, if at all.

Thanks for contributing, and perhaps you could make a follow-up tutorial on how to create a very basic quest.

Just too funny! Thanks for the sig.

rofl… didnt you post a tutorial for delta

This can be easily converted to Delta with some common Java knowledge. But of course, most of the classes said in the OT are in the main class.

I was just pointing out that he was using a base much lower than PI (no idea why he’s making fun of op)

Uh, Delta++ is 100x. Better than PI.

if you say so
[/quote]

Delta and PI are both shit actually.
PI is a tiny bit better then Delta I guess though.
[/quote]
thank you for understanding[/quote]
Oh, in general. yes, Delta and PI are horrible. I was talking about individual bases.

Read full topic

I was just pointing out that he was using a base much lower than PI (no idea why he’s making fun of op)[/quote]I’m sorry but did you just call Delta lower than another base? FYI, ALL bases are only as good as the developer makes it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Quest Point System [PI]
item.dc:creator: @blackflag1 blackflag_
item.description:
@blackflag1 wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:16, topic:520120”][quote author=blackflag_ link=topic=638612.msg4305992#msg4305992 date=1369812622]

[quote]Have A PI
Make sure you have a PI source. [Project Insanity can also be used]

PI is shorthand for Project Insanity.
To the tutorial, you didn’t really explain much of the code, plus the terminology is a bit incorrect. (Refer to the above post)
You also didn’t go into depth on how to make this go to use, if at all.

Thanks for contributing, and perhaps you could make a follow-up tutorial on how to create a very basic quest.

Just too funny! Thanks for the sig.
[/quote]

rofl… didnt you post a tutorial for delta
[/quote]
This can be easily converted to Delta with some common Java knowledge. But of course, most of the classes said in the OT are in the main class.[/quote]
I was just pointing out that he was using a base much lower than PI (no idea why he’s making fun of op)
